result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles Edward Bell Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Applicable fees, assessments, Court costs and surcharges, including a DNA assessment.  You may have to give a swab which you might be able to have expunged under 165.77.
DOC to collect at the rate of 25% of any amounts provided in Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and 973.20  while the defendant is in their control.  Any amounts unpaid when defendant is released from confinfement to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.  
Any monetary amounts unpaid when sentence is completed are ordered reduced to a judgment against the defendant for the unpaid balance and collection can then proceed under sec 71.935 as well as other collection procedures.
Court orders no DV surcharge.

superMiscConds.notes: Undergo a sex offender evaluation. Comply with treatment.
AODA assessment.   Follow through with recommended programming. Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; also advised that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles Edward Bell Jr

records.addlTxt:
Per Remittitur Dated August 20, 2020, Appeal No. 2018AP001850-CRNM, IT IS ORDERED AND ADJUDGED by this court in a decision filed on January 24, 2020, that: 
IT IS ORDERED that the judgment and order are summarily affirmed.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.21. 
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Leon W. Todd is relieved of further representation of Bell in this matter.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.32(3).
records.descr: Remittitur/Court of Appeals dec & order affirming

records.addlTxt: Per order dated August 20, 2020, Appeal No. 2018AP1850-CR, IT IS ORDERED that the petition for review is denied, without costs.

Per order dated February 26, 2020, Appeal No. 2018AP1850-CRNM, IT IS ORDERED that the motion is denied.  The 30-day period in which to file a petition for review may not be enlarged.  First Wisconsin National Bank of Madison v. Nicholaou, 87 Wis. 2d 360, 274 N. W.2d 704 (1979);  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED the motion itself shall be deemed to be a nonconforming but timely petition for review.  However, a statement in support of the petition, conforming to the requirements of Wis. Stat. Rules 809.62(2) and (4), must be filed with the clerk of this court by May 26, 2020.  If the statement is not filed by that time, this petition will be summarily dismissed.  No further time extensions will be granted.

Per order dated January 24, 2020, Appeal No. 2018AP1850-CRNM, IT IS ORDERED that the judgment and order are summarily affirmed.  See WIS. STAT. RULE 809.21.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Leon W. Todd, III,  is relieved of further representation of Bell in this matter.  See WIS. STAT. RULE 809.32(3).  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this summary disposition order will not be published.

Defendant Charles Edward Bell in court with attorney Richard L. Voss.  Defendant Charles Edward Bell in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 27 YEARS and 6 MONTHS, with credit for 473 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 20 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 7 YEARS and 6 MONTHS.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".
Court rejects probation recommendation.
*AODA assessment and follow through with recommended programming; 
*Maintain absolute sobriety with random urine screens.
Defendant to undergo a sex offender evaluation and comply with treatment.
NO CONTACT ORDER REMAINS. 
The court orders no DV Surcharge.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
The Court is imposing the applicable fees, assessments, court costs, and surcharges, including a DNA assessment.  You may have to give a swab, which you might be able to have expunged under 165.77.
The Court orders the DOC to collect any monetary amounts ordered today at the rate of max 25% of any amounts provided in secs 973.05(4)(b) and 973.20 while the defendant is in their control.  Any monetary amounts that remain unpaid when the defendant is released from confinement are to be paid as a condition of the extended supervision.  Any monetary mounts that remain unpaid when the sentence is completed are ordered reduced to a judgment against the defendant for the unpaid balance and collection can then proceed under sec. 71.935 as well as other collection procedures.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;

Defendant Charles Edward Bell in court with attorney Richard L. Voss.  Defendant Charles Edward Bell in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of a Child, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 948.02(2), 939.50(3)(c), a Class C Felony.    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.
